paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.401A>G (p.Tyr134Cys) and penetrance data from affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Various ages, including 15 to 44 years, all Chinese
patients.phenotype: Familial Amyloid Polyneuropathy (FAP) with ocular manifestations

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive bilateral floaters, vitreous opacities, BCVA 20/125 OD and 20/200 OS
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 1 (III:4) was a 44-year-old woman complaining of progressive bilateral floaters that persisted for several months.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive blurred vision, significant vitreous opacities, BCVA light perception OD and 20/800 OS
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 2 (III:1) was the cousin of case 1. He was 40 years old and complained of progressive blurred vision in his left eye for over 2 years.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Decreased vision in left eye, significant vitreous opacities, BCVA 20/20 OD and 20/400 OS
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 3 (III:2) was a 43-year-old brother of case 2. He complained of decreased vision of the left eye for several months.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Bilateral BCVAs of 20/20, mild venous tortuosity
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 4 (IV:1) was the 22-year-old nephew of cases 2 and 3, and case 5 (IV:3) was the 15-year-old son of case 2.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Bilateral BCVAs of 20/20, mild venous tortuosity in left eye
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 5 (IV:3) was the 15-year-old son of case 2.

functional_data.summary: The variant c.401A>G (p.Tyr134Cys) is associated with amyloid deposition in the retina and other ocular manifestations.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, as affected individuals are confirmed to carry the mutation.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of monitoring asymptomatic carriers for potential ocular manifestations.
key_quotes: The results highlight the amyloid deposition of mutant TTR in the optic disc and retina, even in the asymptomatic stage.
Patients with FAP carrying the c.401A>G (p.Tyr134Cys) mutation have a higher prevalence of vitreous opacities.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
